channel.title: Linked List on Lance Wonderland
channel.description: Recent content in Linked List on Lance Wonderland

item.title: Minimum Path Sum
item.description: Description Given a m x n grid filled with non-negative numbers, find a path from top left to bottom right which minimizesthe sum of all numbers along its path. Note: You can only move either down or right at any point in time. Example: Input: [ [1,3,1], [1,5,1], [4,2,1] ] Output: 7 Explanation: Because the path 1→3→1→1→1 minimizes the sum. 0 / \ -3 9 / / -10 5 DP想法:

item.title: Convert Sorted List to Binary Search Tree
item.description: Description Given a singly linked list where elements are sorted in ascending order, convert it to a height balanced BST. For this problem, a height-balanced binary tree is defined as a binary tree in which the depth of the two subtrees of every node never differ by more than 1. Example: Given the sorted linked list: [-10,-3,0,5,9], One possible answer is: [0,-3,9,-10,null,5], which represents the following height balanced BST:
